He at first is unwilling to believe that Toretto may have something to do with it due to the fact that Toretto appears to be a civil type (plus O'Connor is falling in love with his sister). It first appears that Toretto's rival, a violent, and quite psychotic, Triad-type named Johnny Tran, may be the guilty party. But this may be the easy solution.

I had seen this picture before I had seen the earlier POINT BREAK, but as soon as I saw POINT BREAK, I could see similarties between the two. As with POINT BREAK, the easy answer is proved wrong and the truth turns out to be what you hoped wasn't true. The ending also has a similarity to POINT BREAK, which I won't reveal here. But these similarities do not mean that this film is not original. Far from it, the story is great with inventive twists and turns and you eventually find yourself rooting for Diesel.

The two leads are brilliant as is Jordana Brewster as Toretto's sister Mia. In addition, Toretto's racing team are well drawn (well, three of them are anyway). There's Letty, the tough chick (and Toretto's girlfriend), Jesse, the geeky but lovable mechanical expert, Vince, the violent nutjob (who takes exception to O'Connor) and Leon, the other one (he has very little distinguishing characteristics). A pre-DIE ANOTHER DAY Rick Yune is truly menacing as the sadistic Tran.

The cars are also brilliant. The real great ones are the Supra which thegang restores for Walker to race at an Arizona race event, the three black Honda Civics which are used for the hijackings (when did they actually start making cool-looking Civics?) and the black Dodge Charger Dieseldrives towards the end. Toretto states that he never drove the car before because itscared him. According to him, this car has 'so much torque that thechassis twisted when it came off the line', and it certainly proves itself in a final drag race near the end of the film.

The music score may not be to everyone's taste, but the film is overall excellent. The sequel's not too bad either!

title: Not a movie you have to think about
review:
In an earlier review when the film came out, I commented on how awesome the movie was. But really, it's not. It's just okay to watch if you want a cheap pop corn flick with fast cars. It's not a movie you gotta think about, but if you're going to rate the movie, it definitely isn't good. This movie really made Vin Diesel HUGE among teenage audiences, but it wasn't the film that made me like Diesel. If you want to see Diesel actually.... acting, try the movie BOILER ROOM. This film doesn't have much of a plot, not a lot of acting, but it's fun to watch for the cars. So those are my comments after viewing it several more times...

SCORE: 6 out of 10 (okay)

title: A one way ticket to gay.
review:
This movie just demonstrates just how much of a pleasure machine hollywood pretends to be. They give you crap, and you eat it, and this movie made a vagillian dollars, and the sequel is on it's way. And why not? With lines uttered by Ja-Rule such as "Man, this guy's fast." Is that an oscar nod I smell? No, it's this movie.

Now, there are some that may say movies are meant for entertainment. And, I agree, but how entertaining is it to watch one highly choreographed chase sequence? Not very, if you ask me. There was no meat to the story, the characters are flat, and the script was written on a napkin. Anyone who bought a ticket to this movie is holding back the evolution of entertainment. It is a black spot on the timeline of entertainment history. It had nothing new to say, nothing new to share, and everyone fell for it because Vin Diesel is a big hunky lugnut and people like fast cars. Wow.

I give this movie ten stars because it reeled in so many suckers. You should all be ashamed for having such little depth of character. You watch enough movies with melodramatic lines and reactions and you run the risk of getting impregnated by some moron with a fast Neon.

title: What do car chases, lots of cursing and rap music add up to? A pretty weak film.
review:
I wasn't expecting much when I picked this one up at the video store, so maybe it's not as good as I think it is.

The plot is Paul Walker, undercover cop, tries to infiltrate a street racing clique to get to a gang that is hijacking trucks. He is such a hoser! I'm sorry, he just sounds like a hoser! He has the voice of a hoser! (point made)

He gains the trust of Vin Diesel's character, infiltrates the ring...and well, I didn't say there were spoilers so I won't give any. But the plot is tragically underdeveloped. You can see right through everything that everyone does. It's pretty clear that the police will make a mistake before they find out the real hijackers.

Vin Diesel's performance and a surprising ending save this one from the absolute bottom of my list.

4/10

title: Plodding and silly action thriller.
review:
2.5 out of 10

In The Fast and the Furious, Paul Walker stars as an undercover cop who's seduced by the underground world of drag racing. Vin Diesel is the head of one particular racing gang that enjoys stealing DVD players off trucks, preferring to do so while the truck is moving at high speeds, perhap for the sheer thrill of it (and spending countless money on NOS, no less). That's just one of the movie's many idiocies, which would be forgivable if the movie was consistently entertaining. It's not.

Instead of high-octance action, we get too much focus on a plot that's sleep-inducing and actors who look more comfortable posing for a magazine than enunciating dialogue. Only Vin Diesel makes an impression, though he's certainly not aided by the giggle-inducing dialogue ("You break her heart, I break your neck"). As for the story, it can be summed up as Point Break with fast cars and the idiots who drive them. Lead Paul Walker is thoroughly unconvincing as the undercover cop and he shares zero chemistry with Jordana Brewster, the girl whose only purpose in the film is to make him lose his edge. There are a couple of chase scenes near the end that are reasonably fun, but it's too little too late by then. For truly thrilling, mindlessly enjoyable car chase mayhem, watch The Transporter instead.

title: Ach du lieber! Terrible! TERRIBLE!
review: Oh mein Gott, I just kept hoping that this movie would end!  And it was over 100 minutes long!  Oy!  That was about 90 minutes too long.  Paper thin plot (if one could call it that) and lousy wooden acting a la Tony Danza make for a terrible, ignorant movie.  It was the opposite of the ever-heinous "chick flick"--a wicked dopey, testosterone-y guy flick, and an unbelievably bad one.  Save your time and money--watch anything else.

title: Pointless
review:
The kind of film we will look back on in ten years time, and hopefully burn.

Terrible acting, I even thought the fabled action scenes were pure toss.

It had no soul, no balls, no nothing, just a blank slate in my brain where I zoned out of my body for an hour and a bit, went into the dead zone and surfaced again when the credits rolled.

Mindless action movies are fun, I dont doubt this. This film isnt, just a group of people who said "hey, I know how we can get rich and famous quite quickly, heres what we do...remake this little-known car film and sell our souls and good names to the Dark Lord himself".

Pure sweaty balls. Dont be fooled by the hype, watch this tripe at your peril.

title: Rip off that ends up paying off
review: Okay, like the trivia says, this one is too close to Kathryn Bigelow's Point Break. The plot is virtually the same. That alone would be enough to bury this movie if it wasn't the first Hollywood one to use the potential of street racing. So, this movie unique and brutal asset is the adrenaline-pumping action scenes, which teach "Gone in Sixty Seconds" a harsh lesson in emotion. The movie rarely stops, only when the plot has to go forward, so you can expect an eye-popper, which won't leave the action-junkies disappointed. Standard-rate fare, to chew amongst the popcorn and to marvel at the sound editing.

title: Wow. Cars.
review:
The Fast and the Furious has very little going for it, unless you love cars. If you love cars, perhaps you should consider going to a car show.

The plot? Point Break with less surfing and more drag racing. It drags (no pun intended) like hell if you're not into that sort of thing. Vin Diesel is irritating, Paul Walker is Paul Walker in tough-but-nice-guy mode. He's competent enough. The movie was shot like a car commercial, in style as well as substance. The races were okay, the dialogue was stupid ("I live life a quarter mile at a time!") and if they wanted to cater to horny guys, they really should have aimed for a higher rating. That would have made it at least a little more interesting for me.

I have very little to say on this movie. I hated it, and thought it had no substance whatsoever. But if you're into that sort of thing (and the numbers continue to grow) go for it.

2/10.

title: If you liked Smokey and the Bandit or Dukes....
review:
.....then this is the film for you; save you might wanna swap Burt for Vin, throw out the country and toss in rap/rap-rock and up the cartoony quotient jest a tad. I was Not impressed here, you can see the CGI imagery in the 'stunts' a mile away.

(spoilers below I am sure!)

And it's pretty bad when yer rooting for the TRUCKER-I was hoping he'd get Vin after he got Billy Bob there first. I donno-the flick was working alright for me til we find out that the whole Japanese street gang is a red herring, it's really Vin and co. who are the street robbers or whatever. You don't buy for a sec that they can actually DO this and get away without dying first try; much less not get shot.

Some of this is alright-the racing, the obvious KooKoo for Kars approach, the acting OK considering this is nothing more than 'Smokey and the Bandits', and maybe one of those old 50's hotrodder B flix too.

I found that my approach to watching this was to try and enjoy it for what it was-but the farther it wound on, the less appealing it got. The casting of the extras-the gals all right outta Playboy, for example-does kinda hurt even the windowdressing. Yeah sure folks.

Vin Diesel is alright here, nothing special. The rest-pretty generic, right down to the hacker/'Spike Jonz' from Three kings type-it's not original in the least.

So-did I like it? Ummmmmm-it's okay. Would I rec. seeing this over 'Smokey and the Bandit'? Not on yer life.

** outta ****

title: Fast Furious and DUMB!!!!!
review: Okay, so I am 42 and a little too old for the teenyboppers this movie was made for, but I am not hip to all the new Nitrous-fueled rice-burners that represent this generations muscle cars! It all started with the superfast rice-rocket Ninja-cycles of the 80's and evolved into Jap cars with Nitrous! Isn't that the same gas used to discharge whipped cream out of cans you buy in the grocery store? What a JOKE! If you want fast, get a Corvette! Get something that has a rumble, not a sound like a pack of bumblebees! God, that awful whining noise! And the movie was visual eye-candy for the young and the dumb! The lead actor, Paul Walker is handsome enough and looks like a Brad Pitt clone and Vin Diesel plays the machoman with the WWF voice real well too! But gimme a break..the cars have nice paint jobs but they are Japanese crackpipes with 4 cylinders! I would rather have a Z28 or a Trans Am

title: What 'Chu Smoking, People? *Possible MINOR spoilers*
review: COME ON! I heard from my friends and basically everyone in High School that "So Many RISKY STUNTS!", "Oh my god, wicked cars", "So MUCH ACTION!!!". I investigated. It is Horrible! It's basically a car-show. It's got guns, yes, but they arent used effectively and there's only 3 types: Shotgun, Uzi and Pistol. No GunFIGHTS, just illegal street racing. They just drive around showing how fast or how good looking their car is.       The "Stunts" you've been hearing about, there are NONE. There's no high tailed jumps off a bridge racing a plane. There's swerving to the sides in racing, a jump over train tracks after a train passes by, and 1 CRASH. I have to admit, the crash was pretty cool, but that's bascally all. The characters are 2-Dimensional, The cars are just speed machines and eye candy, not stunt cars, and the 2 "stunts" were probably written by a 2 year old who thought of it by playing with TONKA trucks. Avoid if you have 1/19th of a brain in your head!! 1/10 (I gave it a one because of the 1 good crash)

title: The Best Car Movie Ever Made And The Third Best Summer Movie Of 2001
review: This is by far the best car movie ever made. Before this, I thought Gone in 60 seconds was the best car movie. Just by the preview I knew this would be better and it was. There are more cars in 60 Seconds but theres more action, better plot and much better acting. If they put Nicholas Cage in this movie he would have ruined it. I mean he wasn't good in 60 seconds at all. Vin Diesel was the man for the job and he got the job done. Im a little disappointed that he won't be back for the sequel. He chose Pitch Black over Fast and the Furious. Pitch Black sucks. XXX is awesome but not as good as this.

title: Don't believe the hype!
review: Was this movie suppose to be good or even taken seriously?  This was not a good movie.  The worst thing about it was the plot, which sucks to high hell.  I haven't seen trash like this sense the early 90's.  This movie has action and some drama, but it's all so predictable.  Don't expect to be surprised.  I feel so sorry for Rodriguez for doing to film.  She's a pretty good, but she's had much better parts than this.  So, if you like movies about people fighting over who as the fastest car, car stunts (computerized car stunts), and a "Point Break" story line, then you will love this.  For the people out there who want something fresh and exciting, stay away from this garbage.  So many people told me this was their favorite movie.  What have they been watching?!

title: An adrenaline rush for the teens, at least.
review:
It's cool that they named this movie after one of the early episodes of the Road Runner and Wile E. Coyote (The Fast and The Furry-ous). I'm also amazed that it's a PG-13 (read: movie made for maximum box office appeal) that's pretty good. This review is for the Collector's Edition DVD.

Starring rising stars Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Jordanna Brewster, and Michelle Rodriguez (a true Hispanic hottie) and directed by Rob Cohen, the film takes us on quite a ride through the illegal sport of street racing, where combatants in souped-up import cars race at high speeds for money and the cars themselves. This interesting look at a dangerous aspect of driving is padded by a story of an undercover cop looking for criminals who steal high-priced electronics from truckers.

The movie has a great hip image. Whether it's the hipster clothing, the soundtrack, the men and women, or the cars, I think lots of teenage boys and girls should fall in love with this flick. As a 31 year-old, I wasn't as impressed but I still liked this film. The acting is very good and the dialogue is a lot better than most PG-13 films. Of course, you'll feel like you've been for a "Hell of a ride" in these amazing cars. You wish you could own one for your very own.

The Collector's DVD is filled with a whack of stuff. Commentary from the well-spoken director Cohen, a making-of-documentary, deleted scenes, an article called Racer X that inspired the film, three music videos, storyboards, multiple angles of scenes, and tons more. I guess after seeing it, it deserved its success in 2001. You have to respect Diesel for giving up 20 million dollars to be in a sequel. I don't think a sequel would be right for this kind of film.

title: * * out and 4.
review:
Point Break rip off about an undercover cop (Paul Walker) sent in to find out if a local gang headed by Vin Diesel is responsible for a group of robberies. It's loud, it's dumb, and it has a very fast pace. This is a film with a cast full of hunks and hot chicks where each one of raising stars smolders with sexuality and each have their own commanding presences in the film. This is a film where the audience knows on a techincal level for the most part it is pretty bad, but on an entertainment level it is great. Terrific action sequences are an added bonus.

Rated PG-13; Violence, Profanity, and Sexual Content.

title: VROOM VROOM!
review:
I am a guy who really likes this movie cos it has lots of really aaaweseome fast cars and hot girls and the cars rase reelly fast and its so cool theres this mad torana with a v8 engine and it goes so fast and at the end they all go sooo fast and the hot girls are there VROOM VROOM!!

THIS is the level of intelligence of the average viewer of this movie. The only reason that this movie has a decent rating is that it aims ENTIRELY for the 15-30 market of dumb kids (and adults) who dream about having a fast car of their own. It also aims for sad males who like to see women in skimpy clothes who hang around men with fast cars.

And, as you can see by the votes, it achieved what it aimed for. I just warn you, that if you have any level of intelligence, or you are NOT entertained by fast cars which you will never own and women who you will never meet, to stay FAR away from this movie. It has NO story (NONE at all), terrible editing, awful dialogue, poor direction, shoddy acting and it is PACKED with random scenes which seem to only be in the movie to show more cars and women.

Problem with my review is, if you had any sense, you would have stayed well away from this movie, and would not be at this page. But hey...ignorance is bliss.......

title: Slight-of-hand cinematic trickery for the young and the gullible
review: Okay, I know this film was aimed at the 18-25 year market, and I watched it fully aware of the fact it would be filled with roaring supercharged cars and equally supercharged attitudes, but there was one glaring oversight that ruined the total effect for me.  During the street racing scene, where the contestants successfully blocked off about 100 amazingly straight blocks of downtown LA with no apparent notice by the police or unsuspecting motorists, didn't anyone notice that the same supporters, friends, and female groupies were at the finish line RIGHT AFTER the racers arrived?  I mean, no sooner had these guys pulled up than their adoring fans, who had been at the starting line, were piling all over their cars.  What, did they follow them at the same 100+ mph speeds, or did they take the side streets?  And I'd still like to know how they managed to block off all those intersections with hundreds of spectators without tipping the rest of LA off.  For my money, I'd still take "Gone in 60 Seconds" or the classic "Vanishing Point." "Fast and Furious" was not a bad movie, but it was about as believable as "Cannonball Run."

title: This movie was great
review:
I don't know what several of these people are smoking.

The movie was great.

Cast: Not too shabby, Vin Desil was perfect for the part. i couldn't really picture anyone else there.

Storyline:People say its only drag races blah blah. No it's about an undercover cop that is trying to break a truck hijacking ring, but he becomes soft on Vin and his gang, and love gets in the way of his work as well.

The race scenes were cool. The final one was my favorite, :-).

And hot girls, oh COME ON... They are in the background, maybe the movie would be alittle better if ya took your eyes off the girls.

As for the cheesy one liners, you anwser me this. In reality who comes up with an really cool saying? So of course it is gonna be cheesy.

I rate it an 7 because I have seen better movies like, gone in 60 seconds and no man's land.

My advice is to see this movie!

title: Point break + Gone in 60' - good acting = The Fast and the Furious
review:
Believe me, the equation is 100% right. Go see it if you don't believe me. Sincerely this was a stupid movie, It gets too long and tiresome, it a sort of neverending car videoclip that will only work for car lovers. If you are not one of the kind, avoid it at all costs.

3 out of 10 (the cars get all the credit)

title: This movie was the best!
review: My sister had to pay me 5 bucks to watch this movie with her. Afterwards, I had to pay her 15 to buy me this movie! Vin Diesel is totally hot! And Paul Walker was perfect for the undercover part! Michelle Rodregaiz was a perfect Letti, and Jorgana was perfect for Mia. Chad Limburg was excellent as jesse and leon and vince had perfect actors as well. Anything that combines cool cars with hot actors deserves two thumbs up!!

title: Cool-ified No Man's Land (1987)
review:
This movie's been called a rip-off from Gone in 60 Seconds. Well I'd add up No Man's Land (1987) to the list; minus the unhappy ending. Same story: undercover cop goes into the biz, gets the thrill of racing. Difference is that this flick looks "cooler" because of the cars, the hard rock, the chicks ... even though this clandestine drag-racing exists, it was pushed to the "way too unreal" world. I doubt any street racer would have his car filled with "Verisign","Verizon" and other propaganda; it would bring even more attention to the cops. Its street racing, not NASCAR.

It is mildly entertaining, but there is merely ONE car chase scene in the whole movie (more like a "chase the bike" scene). The dialog's cheesy, the plot's swiss-cheesed (full of holes), and there is no real action (except for the aforementioned scene). There's not even enough racing, for the movie tries to develop the "plot" ... without success.

If you are looking for car chase movies, go get No Man's Land (1987), The Driver or Ronin. This isn't that kind of movie.

title: My opinion of The Fast and the Furious.
review: At first I thought this would be a rip-off of Gone in 60 Seconds but I was so wrong. This film is the bomb! The cast are excellent and makes the film even better. It has a good storyline that works well. The chemistry between Vin Diesel (Dom) and Michelle Rodriguez (Letty), Paul Walkers (Brian) and Jordana Brewsters (Mia) was believable. This is a great film and I look forward to the sequel.

title: An uncut music video.
review:
I remember watching the trailer of "The Fast and the Furious" in cinemas. After watching the trailer I decided it maybe a decent enough movie, with plenty of thrilling car chases through huge cities kind of like "The Italian Job" and "The Driver" style...

I was wrong.

The Fast and the Furious feels more like a two hour music video than a movie. What we have here is a load of loonies thinking their really cool in their powered-up Honda's with hi-fi systems so loud that they could probably wake the dead. Add in a load of muscle-bound punks, girls who try their up most to look sexy and tough and we have this dumb minded movie.

Confusion also reigned during this movie, whats with the fight at the start of the movie? Lame.

As for the car chases...they weren't what I was expecting, it's just drag racing in flashy cars. A lot of people have praised this movie for having fantastic stunts and yes there are a few decent one's towards the end but they aren't that mesmerising ...I've seen better.

The directer obviously thought he was creating some kind of "way cool" movie for the youth of today. With the likes of Limp Bizkit booming in the background, it's a shame this movie will seem old and out dated within a few years.

If your looking for a decent car chase movie watch either "The Driver" or "The Italian Job" the cars didn't look as good...but at least those movies had a plot and decent actors.

4/10

title: ROB COHEN'S A GENIUS!
review:
this movie is the bomb! it's my all time favorite! i mean, what more can you ask for? great stunts, awesome cast, cool cars, and a great story!

to whoever said the dialogue is bad, it's supposed to be! it's street lingo, not proper english! vin diesel was absolutely awesome. the role of dominic toretto fits him really well. of course, he's sexy too but let's not forget his talent. he is one of the most talented actors in hollywood. paul walker is awesome, he's hot and also talented. michelle rodriguez is the bomb! she just rocks! she's a kick butt chick and the role of letty fits her real well. jordana brewster is also awesome, she plays her part really well.

to whoever said the actors couldn't act, well think again. i rented the DVD and went back to the store to buy it. the bonus materials are great, especially the making of the movie and the music videos. this movie explains the whole street racing world really well and they got great cars!

i also liked johnny strong who played leon and chad lindberg who played jesse. matt schulze (vince) was awesome, too. he played the part really well.

i saw this movie practically 10 times and would continue to watch it over and over and over again. i would never get tired of watching it. i recommend this to anyone. this movie absolutely rocks!

i liked this movie 'cause it's not all street racing. there's a bit of drama and some funny situations. there's dominic who explains how his dad died, paul walker who's undercover and falls in love with mia (jordana) and letty whose boyfriend is dominic. i'm telling you if you haven't seen this movie, rush to the video store and buy it--don't rent it.

"What do they plan on racing with, hopes and dreams?" "What'd you put in that sandwich?"

P.S. did i say this movie rocks???

title: Ok.
review: The Fast and the Furious has got one thing going for it that really sets it a part. It has got some of the best car stunts I've ever seen in the movies. I mean some of the stunts simply blow your mind. This movie besides that didn't impress me all too much, sure it had some very good looking ladies in it and they did a fairly good job acting as well as Ted Levine, Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, and the others did. All in all it wasn't terrible but it wasn't even close to being great. 5.8 *'s out of 10 *'s.

title: Glorified music video
review: This film is bad, not in the good sense, in the very bad sense. It is a music video, in fact has less depth than music videos and is a filmic fantasy for boy racers. The dialogue is pitiful, boring and clichd and the characters are little more than pretty cardboard cutouts...including the "A.D.D." sufferer who actually seems to be autistic and not a sufferer of attention deficit disorder.

title: A dangerous movie for kids
review:
*MILD SPOILERS*

Once in a while I see a movie that really provokes me. This was such a movie. First of all the plot is not only bad - it's as good as absent. Second comes the moral of the movie that we are all good guys - we just drive recklessly risking the lives of - well anyone - and rob trucks with the most stupid method in the world (they would get themselves killed in the first attempt). But we're good guys, our leaders dad died in a car crash and that's why we are the way we are. And the truck drivers that get robbed are the bad guys of course - along with the cops. And what's with the cars???? Why are they all basically Asian or Asian-looking in America??? And those colors...yuck. What about the green light from under car....kinda cool in the races maybe, but when robbing a truck??? Get real! Everything sucked about this movie...including the actors. Since some braindead action at least made it not boring, and because there ARE in fact a few movies out there that are even worse, I give it a 3/10. But that's only because I'm a real good guy - no matter what.

title: Whats so yucky about it?
review: I didnt see much wrong about it..there's stereotyping(guys,cars,girls,asians..) but thats fine dude. Its a b grade movie and accept that fact. Some people can stomach it and some cant. Dont try to elevate this to a A-budget movie and then critize it. Its much better than the b grade flicks out there which make you sleepy before the movie's half done. It deserves a 6 or 7 out of 10. My 2 cents....

title: Loved it!
review: i've read a lot of comments saying that this movie totally sucked...i don't see it!  what was really so sucky about it?!? it's the adrenaline that had you at the edge of your seat...unless you're a big Vin Diesel fan (like me) then he had you at the edge of your seat!  (lol)  overall, it was a terrific movie that has funny one-liners, action, speed, hot guys, and sexy girls...everything for everyone!  that's all you need...

title: I LIVE IN HEMET...
review: A part in the movie was shot in HEMET ,California ,I remember it was in the newspaper it was going to be Redline ,but I guess they changed it. But I did think it kind of sucked not to be mean or anything it did, I do love Paul Walker in it!

title: Tripe, somewhat entertaining tripe.
review:
Ok I avoided this movie like the plague. The trailer made it look like nothing but stupid stunts, and sex...all while Limp Bizkit played. They made it look like a movie about car freaks, and who the heck wants to see a movie about idiots who spend thousands on something as stupid as a car?

Well I gave in and rented it (after a recommendation from a friend), once you get past the first 15-25 minutes of pure hollywood crap, you basically have a B-movie plot with A-movie stunts.

The first 15-25 min. (I didn't keep track) are pure torture. They start off with the illegal street racing scene, which is something out of the 1960's. The latinos are all in one group, the Asians are all in one group, and the blacks all hung out in one group. Apparently their love of cars brings them together, but not enough to intermix socially. And of course all of the guys in the movie look like they have been working out in the gym daily since they were five years old, and all the women look like they just got off their Playboy and Maxim photo shoots.

Then of course to bring in more kids, we have to watch Ja Rule, a very annoying rapper, who should not act, or rap for that matter, get swooned over and offered a threeway. Apparently all Playboy and Maxim models are crazy for guys who will spend thousands on car parts and win at illegal street racing. And then of course it turns out that the Asians in the movie are a gang of low life thugs, another bad movie cliche.

And of course there is Vin Diesel's gang, which follow all the typical gang stereotypes. Vin is the cool leader, who all in the illegal car world look up to, and everybody respects and listens to. Then there is Letty (Rodriguez) who is his tough girlfriend, who is presumed frail and then kicks all male butt she comes in contact with. Then Vince (Schulze) his hot-headed right hand man, whose temper has to constantly be kept under control. Then Leon (Strong) who has no role in the gang what-so-ever, yet they make him seem important. And finally Jesse (Lindberg) who is the smartest out of all of them and has the usual "smart guy, frail body" physique, and is the youngest one.

Eventually the story is about Brian (Walker) being an undercover cop and hunting down the robbers of trucks full of electronic equipment. The dialouge and acting is cheesy, but for those who can stomach b-movie fodder, it's no big deal.

Basically the big payoff is the last 20 minutes, which feature amazing car chase scenes, and very cool stunts. My jaw was on the floor through some of those scenes, because you could tell that none of that was faked, no CG, just stunt drivers (maybe, I don't know if the actors did all their own stunts) and well choreographed stunts.

Basically I recommend you rent it, laugh at the cliches and bad dialouge and acting, and then let your jaw drop when you get to the final scenes.

title: A great movie
review: Well i think a girl is the last person i'd let review this movie unless she's living in the fast lane.First of all i think for a movie at this budget it is very well done. Second the acting may have not been great but i don't think it was terrible.Third I just enjoyed it  instead of being typical and saying like oh this movie sucks or what not.I didn't produce it or have to go through the shooting and i'd respect this movie cause i think it was very good at  portraying the racing scene.See i myself race a Honda CRX,so i know you'll think oh yeah he's liking it just for the cars well yes and no.I thought this movie had better cars then the movie "Bullet" though i think that movie was better i am not gonna be one of this sterio typical movie geeks and say oh it's not as good as the old on,well the fast and furious that was made in 1954 isn't good ladys and gentlemen.And bullet did have a better plot but this movie was raw to show what we kids do on the street.And for the  lines that the actors use? well this is like real people and not fancy talk so if you can't stand that enough to not see this movie then well you've got to just watch it.I'd say on a scale one to ten this was a eight and that is  playin it straight and not being typical a to a guy flick like girls are.

title: not bad at all
review: This seems to be one of those things where there are two types of people: ones who loved, and ones who hated it. I happen to be one of the ones who loved it, I unlike the reviewer who's review was the first one shown as I right this thought the dialog was written fine, vin diesel is a good actor, and that a large amount of this movie's apeal is in how the car scenes are shot. In alot of movies, when they try to throw cars into the mix, you get bored, the shots are too centered, it gets boring, everytime they race the cars here, the screen shakes and gives me (and anybody else who loved this movie) an awesum rush. All in all, don't believe what ANYBODY tells you about this movie, it's really the sort of thing that you need to see for yourself to know if you love it or hate it. See it for yourself and make YOUR OWN opinion.

title: What is everyone talking about?
review: That's all I'm asking, why do people on the net bomb this movie? THIS MOVIE WAS AMAZING. With all it's star power and incredible stunts, The Fast And The Furious to me will forever remain an amazing movie. Paul Walker is a secret undercover cop who enters the world of street racing to find out who's been hijaking transport trucks with merchandise. Vin Diesel is Domonic Teretto, the king of the street races. I had a great time with this film. All those fast cars and stunts ( THE best stunt is saved for last)... I'm glad I own it on DVD. If you are as nuts about muscle cars, NOS and Action, this is your movie.

title: Bad script; worse acting; top movie.
review:
BAD SCRIPT, WORSE ACTING, TOP MOVIE.

If you've seen the film, you'll know that there's little more I have to add. If you haven't, you probably won't be surprised. A movie involving lots of fast (and expensive) cars was never going to be very deep, with probably little money left over for decent actors or scriptwriters after paying for the cars and stuntmen.

The film sets out to be a commercial, high octane (excuse the pun), loud and colourful one, and it is, and is no more. It's not SUPPOSED to have any sort of intellectual appeal; appeal is based on excitement. Whether or not this is any bad thing is up to the viewer, but personally, I enjoyed switching my brain off for an hour and a half and enjoying some good-old-fashioned stupid excitement. 7/10

title: Best movie I've seen yet!!
review:
I totally disagree with the few negative comments a few people have made about this movie. I think The Fast and the Furious is one of the best movies made in many years. Everything is good about it. There are no boring scenes, and no boring characters!

Anyone who enjoys thriller, action, adrenalin packed movies ought to see this movie and enjoy it! The plot was well written and the actors are at their finest. Even if someone is not particularly a Vin Diesel or Paul Walker fan etc., this movie is sure to keep the viewer at the edge of their seat!

title: Point break with cars
review: Despite being a great advert for various makes of cars, this is not a bad film. Forget the plot  the cars (and races) are most definitely the stars here. Paul Walker is the young motor enthusiastic with a taste for speed who strives to prove himself to street racing icon Vin Diesel and his gang of race crazy mates, not forgetting his very sexy sister! (Jordanna Brewster  The Faculty), but has he a hidden agenda?, something involving the frequent hijacking of lorries maybe?. Think Point break with cars instead of surfboards and you've got the making of a watchable action yarn.

title: For those of you who hated this movie. . .
review:
there is, actually, a reason to see it again. Or at least, to not turn off the TV when there's nothing else on and it's on cable for free, which is how I ended up watching it.

*****SPOILERS (OF THIS FILM & OTHERS) WITHIN, PLEASE TAKE NOTE******

The thing to watch for here is not the extended music video B.S. that creates the excuse for whatever plot there is, to occur. What you want to watch, if you watch it again, is the rather poignant (tongue in cheek, here) love story that develops --not between Brian and Mia (who in the world thinks bland and boring Jordana Brewster is hotter than the kick-ass Michelle Rodriguez?), but between Brian and Dom! Yes, it's true --the whole Brian/Mia thing is just a front (and a very shabbily executed front, at that) to fool the ultra-macho "target audience" into thinking that Brian's conflict and eventual fall from grace in the eyes of the law are the result of his feelings for a girl. What feelings? What happened between Brian and Mia was a walk-through of a budding relationship. No chemistry, no romance, no sex --just some friendly eye contact and jokes about tuna fish. Yes, they do go to bed together --but you only know that because Brian gets a phone call from his boss afterward and she happens to be lying next to him when he answers. She really does not need to be in this movie at all --not even as the catalyst for the animosity between Brian and Vince, because Vince seems just as jealous of Brian's growing intimacy with Dom as with Mia. It's Dom who really inspires Brian's admiration, his respect, his friendship, his loyalty and his devotion. And Dom, to an extent, returns the favor --he takes Brian under his wing, treats Brian more as his equal than he does his motley band of punk friends; he shows Brian his special secret muscle car, exposing his sensitive side by admitting that he's scared to drive the car, telling the story of his father's death and sharing how he feels when he races. And the train/jump scene at the end --a pretty damn cool stunt, granted; but note the "Thelma and Louise"-esque moment as they look into each others' eyes and make that death-defying jump in sync, together. And what everyone seems to forget is that Dom does not crash the black car jumping the train tracks --he gets broadsided because he's so engrossed in sharing that post-jump bonding moment with Brian that he doesn't see the other car coming. Then at the end, you'd expect there to be some sort of conflict in Brian's mind as he could either make his big bust and put away a legitimate criminal, or let Dom go. Hell, even Jennifer Lopez in "Out of Sight" shot George Clooney when she had to. But Brian doesn't hesitate. He not only lets Dom go, but gives him a rather expensive getaway car.

In short, trust me: this movie is very (and I'm sure, unintentionally) amusing to watch, in the proper light.

That all said, Vin Diesel --even in this shallow sort of offering-- is crazy/sexy/cool, and I wouldn't blame anyone of any gender or persuasion for following his scrumptious ass around.

title: Hot cars, Hot guys equals...
review:
a good MTV like film. I really liked the car racing scenes, although there should have been more. Both Vin Diesel and Paul Walker are really hot but the acting wasn't to great, but what can you expect when you are dealing with such bad dialogue with my personal fav being "Smoke 'em". I think the music helped out a lot since the plot was lame.

(SPOILERS): In the last hijacking scene, how could there have not been any other cars on that highway? They could have at least shown a couple of other cars get run off the road. And why didn't Dom race Johnny Tram at race wars? The race wars was built up to be this big event, but then hardly anything happened. We only saw 2 short races there.

And I would have liked to seen a better ending. At least show Paul Walker get led off in handcuffs. I mean, those guys robbed truckers and could have killed people on the road, and the cop just lets them go at the end because we(the audience) are supposed to see the Johnny Tram gang as being the really bad guys. Dom's gang was just as bad, and I can't believe a real cop would just let them get away like that. And another problem I had was if someone wrecks a car going 160 mph, I don't think they could just get out and walk away with a little cut on the head. If they didn't get killed, they at least would have a bunch of broken bones or be knocked unconscious.(END OF SPOILERS)

FINAL VERDICT: The cars, music, and eye candy kept my attention all the way through. It's worth seeing.

title: Hey! Let's copy Point Break, only with cars!
review:
I have never seen a more blatant ripoff of another movie in my life. The makers of this flick took the plot of Point Break and used cars instead of skydiving and surfboards. Let's see -- instead of Keanu Reeves (the worst actor of all time, BTW) as an undercover FBI agent we have Paul Walker as an undercover cop. Instead of Patrick Swayze as the cold guru who takes the undercover FBI agent under his wing we have Vin Diesel as the cold guru who takes in the undercover cop under his wing. Instead of the ex-girlfriend of the guru falling for the undercover cop it's the younger sister of the guru falling for the undercover FBI agent. Instead of an ending in Australia it's in Mexico. Instead of robbing banks they rob trucks. Pathetic. I can't believe how many people actually liked this lameexcuse for a film. Gee... fast cars... too bad there are only 3 races scenes in the entire movie -- TOTAL. Nevermind that one of them is between the Japanese guy and the clueless fool of a friend.

Lame, lame, lame. Rent Point Break for the original plot. Or if you really want to see a movie about cars try Days of Thunder or even the remake of Gone in 60 Seconds. Neither is that great, but both are WAY better than this trash.

title: Fast cars? Yes. Good plot? No. Worth Watching For the Sake of the Cars? Maybe. You Decide.
review:
The Fast and the Furious is a pure adrenaline filled action movie. A real tough guy film. Fast cars, great stunts. The works. Unfortunately, this can't completely make up for the other mistakes.

The casting of the Fast and the Furious was pretty bad. Vin Diesel can't act. People like him because he's tough. Some said he's the next Schwarzenegger. Yeah right. However, that's not what ruined the film. It's simply everyone else. Paul Walker is horrible especially. Michelle Rodriguez (Resident Evil) is okay. She was better in Resident evil. Somehow though, all these combinations were horrible.

The plot itself is just stupid. Anyone seeing this should focus on the stunts and cars, because obviously that's what the director did. I mean, it's one of the most predictable movies ever. And the ending was pretty dumb(though not as bad as it could be.)

Another thing about THE FAST AND THE FURIOUS is the rating. The rating board must have been pressured by the company who released THE FAST AND THE FURIOUS into a PG-13, because this film should've been rated R. I was reading a review a critic wrote, and he said that two male teenagers in front of him said, "Man, that should've been rated R." The critic said he couldn't agree more. Same here. Not even the small amount of violence in this film should make it R, but the language(I counted at least 3 F words), and the street racing. After this movie was released I saw on the news that some percentage of car accidents had gone up. I forget how much though.

Still, does all this make the FAST AND THE FURIOUS a pass? You can decide for yourself on your own taste. I personally, even if it was stupid, am glad for watching it just for the races, cars, and the HUGE stunt at the end. Other than that, I wouldn't watch it. But if you like cars and stunts, and really big, adrenaline pumped guy movies, than I wouldn't pass THE FAST AND THE FURIOUS UP just for the stupid stuff. It's not incredibly bad, because the above I mentioned makes up for it. It's a hard vote, but I'll give it a 3. Not for a film as a whole, but for the small sequences I loved in it. 3/5 stars.

title: Stoooopid...
review:
I really dug the fast cars, and there was more than enough eye candy, but a reasonable, realistic plot might be in order...

Perhaps some might say "it could happen," and I believe this, but I would have bought it more had they sold drugs or...whatever.

For flash and so on, this was definitely tops, but it was substantial for little else. I even bought the dialogue, but it was still a dumb plot. I wouldn't glorify any other way...

title: a well done flim
review:
To Hydrofuzz: For you to call this one of the worst movies you have ever seen, you must havent seen many. I recommend you go see Smokers or Dead in the water.And frankly no one cares that you didnt want to see the movie... And I understand you didnt know what the appeal of the movie was because you dont know crap about cars. And for you to judge saying "Fast cars do not make a good movie" Some people happen to like cars and enjoy watching movies on them. I would probably laugh at what you would think is a good movie.

And your whole agurement on the dialoge not up to your standards was awful. Do you think they care about dialogue in a peace like this? And to say if you want to hear real people talk you will go to the Barbor shop? How redneck is that! Oh wait Im sorry your from Iowa thats understandable. Could you be anymore naive?

So you go after the plot too..damn nothing makes you happy. The plot was actually rather well. Plus NASCAR isnt that great you want to see real cars race watch formula one. But I wouldnt except you to understand that you didnt even get the movie. They even tired to simplifly it for people like you.

But your going after the actors saying they spent to much on the cars and couldnt afford to hire real ones? I have you know hunny that Vin Diesel is getting paid 10 million dollars for his next peace XXX. Firth rate actors...? right..How much do you make...

Your comparision to riding a bus and a car was laughable. But to everyone else that is reading this im terribly sorry you had to read this I just needed to bitch about her points. I hope someone else can relate to this and I hope you see this (Hydrofuzz).

title: this was an awesome movie!!!
review: this was an amazing movie, if u like real world scenarios and hot cars....this movie is for you!!!the casting is incredible, the dialouge...while not always child-friendly...is completely accurate and def portrays the real racing scene...definitely dont' let smaller kids watch this movie b/c some of the concepts are a lil hard to understand and the language can get pretty rough...but overall this was an awesome movie...

title: MTV
review: It's a movie about a bunch of cool dudes wearing cool clothes and cool haircut and driving cool cars. The camera work and sound editing is also meant to be cool throwing way too much of everything at the audience. And if this was not already enough coolnest, here comes the cool music. The flavor-of-the-week soundtrack is a mix of all the teenager cool hip-hop and cool new-metal hits. It's loud and constant. It's sometimes hard to hear the actors deliver their cool one-liners. The entire thing looks like a cross between a car ad and a sexy MTV mega-hits video. I guess I'm just not cool enough. 3/10.

title: something for everybody
review: some people said they loved this movie and some said they hated it,but personally i thought it was great!!there are hot people(both guys and girls),fast cars,and a good plot despite what some people say.it's called the fast and the furious because of the street racing and the life that comes with it!the whole movie couldn't just keep showing races cuz it would get too boring so they had to add the plot in of brian o'conner becoming friends with dom.it was predictable in the part that everyone knew that dom was the one doing the hi-jacking and not johnny tran.it did show somewhat of an insight though.paul walker went undercover with one view point and came out of it with a totally different one!he saw what a pretty tight group they were and that was the only life they knew.the only  thing that bothered me was when vin diesel flipped the charger at the end and he came out of it with only a cut on his head!! they couldn't have ended it with him dying though cuz it would've been stupid. i think the reason they really didn't show what happened to paul walker and stuff at the end was because they knew there was gonna be a sequel and they were leaving it up to that!! i can't wait for the sequel and i hope it's just as good as the first!

title: Unfortunately so average...
review: Cross Point Break with Gone in 60 Seconds - and you get this one. Boring, predictable, unoriginal; good-looking good guys, bad-looking good guys, really bad bad guys and really good bad guys. BORING as boring can be. The dialogue is so pathetic, one feels sorry for great actors like Diesel who probably were not allowed to change the dialogue and say it better. I CAN'T BELIEVE this film... I have to admit though that most of the actors are pretty good (should be especially hard with a dialogue that primitive and the film so predictable in every single moment.) Also, the last few scenes are much more dynamic and interesting and dramatic and have at least SOME degree of unpredictability (not like anyone wonders in the last few minutes about Brian and what he will do, huh?) Also, Jordana Brewster after an incredible start in The Faculty never got any good roles (I hope someone will make a Love Story remake - she would get an Oscar for that probably), but COME ON - one hears/sees Yale and her intellect in every sentence, body move, smile, etc. - what the... would this girl be doing as a waitress/homemaker to her driver brother? Anyway, I'm pretty disappointed but I don't think the film is bad - it's just average - nothing one would expect from these actors - would have been pretty good for category B movies. I hope Brewster and Diesel get better in picking scripts (or agents) next time. I still think they (and Walker) are really good actors. Good luck to them but not to the folks who made this film. Sorry, you guys have no business making films - unless of course everyone is looking for repetition of the same old in every single film...

title: True reason..
review: This movie, to me at least, was awesome. I believe that the only reason that all these people are doggin it is because they are jelous. There is no way in this world that any of them could have done what these actors and actresses have done to make this movie come to life, and as for that Keanu movie that everyone said that this is a remake of, what the hell is Austin Powers than? Because those plot lines did'nt just come out of thin air (James Bond anyone??)...But I will admit that the only bad thing about this movie was having Ja Rule playing a role..not only did he suck, but it was just humiliating to watch..besides that, I loved it and can not wait for the sequel to come out and show us just what happened to Dominic and Brian.

title: This movie is off da hook!
review: This movie is off da hook. It has all the action, and let me say Paul and Vin are great actors. Vin looks really hot! This movie was so good that I bought it! I don't understand why people are saying this movie sucked or what ever but it was good. All my friends love this movie too. I give it 10/10!

title: You've GOT to be kidding me...
review:
Cute guys in hot cars, that's one thing, but bad acting and poor editing? Unforgivable. Not even Vin Diesel and Paul Walker looking all tan and squinty-eyed could save this FLOP. Walker and Diesel were average (I've seen them both do much better), and the rest of the Team was pretty good, but what was up with the cops and the FBI? Wooden, stale and boring.

The day fading into night scene was cute - the first time! It was like the cinematographer skimmed through the "Filming for Dummies" book the night before shooting began.

Oh, and Ja Rule in his break out performance? Puh-leeze. He should stick to "singing" the hooks for Jennifer Lopez and Ashanti.

I gave it a 4 out of 10 for the guys and the cars.

title: Fast cars...bad acting
review:
As others have already said, I didn't have an interest in seeing this movie, even though my friends always made a big deal about it. The only way I was seeing this movie was if I didn't have to pay for it, which I didn't. I enjoyed the fast cars, because, I like fast cars. I am sure that this movie, and the sequel which is scheduled to come out next year, will forever be a cult classic amongst the import-race car enthusiasts. Yet, those people will watch the movie not for the amazing acting or directing or writing, but for the fast paced car scenes. This is the way I would only watch this movie again, just to see the fast cars. Vin Diesel was boring, monotone, and simply unbelievable as a person. His speeches were well rehersed, but they came off as phony and unemotional. Paul Walker was perhaps the best actor in the movie. I have seen him in other films so I know this wasn't his acting high point. I would have to blame the director and/or the writer for this. Walker had his moments, but there were some very lame ones too. There were too many points in the movie that left me hanging. Diesel's character and the leader of the Asian gang exchange some words early on in the film which builds the tension and the excitement for the rest of the movie. The whole time I am thinking that we are going to see a hard core drag race match-up between the two characters- and we never do. We see a fist fight between them, but it isn't what I wanted. It wasn't what the film pumped up. The final scene was just about pointless and useless for the film. Nothing was resolved. A drag race and a car is demolished. Out of everybody, we know that one person is dead, another wounded, a couple MIA, and nothing is certain, or even hinted at what the future has for the two main characters.

It had good editing, and good cinematography, but that can't make the movie. Bad acting, bad directing along with a bad script simply made the movie bad. I give it a 5 out of 10, only because I wanted to see the cars, and wanted to see if it was going to get any better. I was really anticipating a nude scene, or even some more skin with Michelle Rodriguez, yet that never happened either. I was disappointed by her role as well, since I had heard all this excitment about her in the movie.

title: this is a good place to find a movie your looking for.
review: this movie is the bomb the best movie i have watched and would tell all my friends to buy this movie better to get it on dvd if you can. the hottest part of the movie is Vin Diesel. he is the bomb in the whole movie.

title: Better than i thought it was going to be, but it still sucked.
review: When i first rented this movie i knew it was going to be a stinker. To my surprise it actually grabbed my attention and kept me watching, but by the time it was over i realized i had been watching an obvious copy of Point Break. Of course in this movie they use cars instead of surfboards. I always thought that Keanu Reeves and Patick Swayze were a lot cooler than Paul Walker and Vin Diesel. Paul Walker wasn't a bad actor but Vin Diesel underacted his part so bad that it ruined the movie for me (man did that guy sound like an idiot). Ja Rule's scene was one of the most pathetic piece of movie i have ever seen in my life. He couldn't even see above the steering wheel he was so short (were talking Honda Civics here). The plot was okay, but since it had already been done in Point Break im not going to give this movie any points for it. If you want to see unrealistic street racing and explosions with rap music in the background this movie is for you. If you want to see a good action movie with an original plot and cool dudes i would recommend Point Break (1991).

title: silly
review: I didn't like this movie because he "racing" in it is nothing more than driving really fast down a straight path and seeing who can hit the nitro button first. I was expecting hairpins, fast turns and intense action, but all I got was a bunch of ghetto teens sitting in fast cars and without doing much steering, push one solitary button every 10 seconds that makes them go turbo before their engines overheat and die. Quite frankly if they were travelling that fast in those type of car, the cars would have tore themselves apart. Vin Diesal sounds like he's talking in slow motion and thus sounds very dumb. Thumbs down.

title: Deja vu (Spoiler)
review:
***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** Simple formula. Take the plot from Point Break (1991), remove surf boards, add fast cars. After that it plays out exactly the same.

  • Cop infiltrates gang of surfers/ street racers to catch thieves. - Cop suspects rival gang but the thieves turn out to be the gang he joined -cop falls in love with member of the gang. -cop becomes best friends with gang leader. -gang plans one last score that goes horribly wrong.


If you're looking for a movie with an original plot and good acting this is not it. (Vin Diesel being the exception). If you're looking for a movie with fast cars and lots of splosions this one's got it. I gave it a 5.

title: I really enjoyed seeing this in the theater for one reason
review:
The reason was the theater was air conditioned (our apartment is not). The film was a small theater matinee, only $3.50, a STEAL by today big city standards!) For about $2/hr I got a fairly comfy seat and super cool AC! Not bad! We snuck in our snacks bought beforehand at Walmart thereby increasing the value of the afternoon.

Oh, by the way - one of the most pointless, vapid, cliched, stupid, overhyped/produced/stylized, underacted/directed/written pieces of Curr-appp-ola I have ever seen. When I even bothered to look at the screen. Hot cars and sexy young newcomers to the screen couldn't even save this loser.

title: totally wicked
review:
This movie kicked f**kin' ass...... I watched it over and over at least four times in one day...

It features totally kitted out cars, features a mental soundtrack...and had a very good plot...

I definatly recommend it.....and i have voted a 10/10 for it.

title: Great Movie
review: I thought this movie was great i cant wait to see the Second one. Some people did not like it because of the Actors but i think that it was the actors that made it come alive and Vin Diesel was great as "Dom" the cars where what made the Movie seem more real if it would have been about anything else then it would not have been called The Fast and the Furious, i belive that the title is what makes the movie *in some ways* i gave this movie a 10 because i loved it and its a movie that you can watch over and over again.

title: What a great movie
review: How can you not like this movie?  It has hot cars, hot women and some very cool stunt driving.  What more can you ask for in a movie?  Yeah there might have been some parts that were a little too predictible but the action was great and made up for any of that.  For the critics who said it was just a movie about racing cars they couldn't have been more wrong.  The whole story line behind The Fast and The Furious was great, when you first watch it you are suprised to find out Brians (Paul Walkers) real job, and then the chase sceene at the end where Vin Diesel and Paul Walker are chasing Jonny Tran and his cousin through the town was amazing.  The best part of the whole movie has to be when Diesel unleashes the monster of a car (the charger). All in all it was a great movie that you can never get sick of.

title: Not a great racing movie
review:
I'm a big fan of cars, being an avid player of games like Gran Turismo. And basically I was surprised this movie is considered a racing movie.

Racing in a straight line is not exciting, I wish people in the movie business would realize this. But that's not the only thing wrong with this movie. Let's forget for a moment that the plot is really thin, the dialogue horrible, and there's no acting to speak of. The racing is just plain unrealistic. A car speeding by at over 100 miles/hour, spinning out of control and stopping within 20 yards is just not possible. And you can't possibly survive a collision at over 100 mph when you're not wearing at least seatbelts and preferably a helmet. And if you would, you would never be able to get up, get into another car and speed away. There's a lot of action in the movie, but it's never involving. To be honest I had expected more from the director of "Dragon: The Bruce Lee Story". I suggest you watch "Driven" or "Gone In 60 Seconds" if you want to see some real exciting racing.

title: In order to like the movie you have to understand STREET RACING!
review: I myself loved the movie. The intense car races and good looking guys. I loved the plot and there was a plot for all of you who said there wasn't. Maybe you should watch it again, and if your too ignorant to watch it again so people like me can prove you wrong then I guess you already no your wrong. Now if your one of those people who have nothing to do with street racing then by it's trailers you should have known it wasn't a movie for you. Which it other words means you wasted $8 or $9 bucks and your the only one to blame for it. The whole movie was summing up exactly what happens when you street race and when your apart of that crowd. So I suggest if you didn't like this movie don't even attempt to show up to watch street racing because if you do your most likely going to be watching " The fast and the Furious" again.

title: Fast & Predictable.
review: Just when you thought that perhaps the movie wouldn't continue down it's inexorably predictable path anymore: It does. Suspense and surprise are thrown away in this movie. It also really doesn't have a really good race until the very end of the move, by which time you are merely waiting for the movie to finish in the unbelievably 'made to a Hollywood checklist' way that it does.

title: Addictive!
review:
If you went into the theaters thinking that you would somehow walk out with a profound sense of life or a life-changing moral message, then you must be a complete freakin' idiot! At no point did the movie or the production crew sell the movie as such. It was commercialized as a "racer" movie. By this, it means it was catering to "racers" or people who love fast cars.

This was the most rented video in the year it went out on video and made a ridiculous amount of money in the box office. Yes, there was little to no plot. Yes, the dialogue was weak and the acting was below mediocre. Yes, some parts were incorrect (NOS is inflammable). But that was not the point of the movie. It was made to attract those race fans. And make fans of those (like me) who aren't.

Speaking from experience, it served its purpose. Kudos to the cast and crew.

title: Little Substance, Lots of Bang
review:
The Fast and the Furious is too much glitz and not enough plot. Paul Walker cannot act at all. While fans may think Vin Diesel is cool, that is not enough to carry this film. The only appealing part of this movie was the action sequences, in which they were very well done. It had some nice plot twists, but it seemed as if the director didn't care at all about the plot, he just wanted to blow things up. This definitely qualifies as a teen movie.

Grade: C+

title: Hydrofuzz doesn't know movies.
review: First of all, you have to understand street racing to understand the plot. Just like if you don't understand politics then you wouldn't enjoy political movies. The acting in this movie was done almost to perfection. The actors draw you into the movie because they DO talk like people usually do. Now I don't know about you, but I hate watching those movies where when someone is about to get shot, they come up with something crafty and clever to say. That's just not how it is in real life. And Hydrofuzz, if you didn't want down to earth acting, then why go see movies that are based on reality such as the Fast,instead of movies based on fantasy? And this movie is based on reality, trust me, I used to street race, and so did alot of my friends.

title: Depends on what ur looking for in a movie...
review: This movie wasn't for everyone... to tell u the truth, i loved the movie but it really didn't have much of a plot (other than a cheesy one) and there were some moments of bad acting, but being that this is the first movie involving the import scene I thought it was a pretty good first shot, because things need to be said and cars need to be seen ;)... Personally, I liked it because I am involved in import racing (doesn't always have to be illegal u know!!) and thought that this movie shows how, in the import scene, race doesn't matter, gender doesn't matter... it's all about friends and all about enemies, and most of all its about loyalty and going places very, VERY fast!

title: The best film ever made about racing cars!!!!!
review:
The Fast and the Furious is by far my favorite movie. The thrill and intensity of all that torque put to use sends chills up my spine. Every actor in that movie fit perfectly in their spot. Anyone that has no respect for fast cars that sees the movie anyway has no right to trash the making of it.

Fin.

title: Car Porn
review:
The title says it all. With more than enough high-performance cars to salivate over, high-testosterone machismo, and more high-adrenaline action and speed than a dozen "Gone In Sixty Seconds", we have a winner. Admittedly thin on important things like plot, good dialogue, and character development, the film is fun ride and doesn't try to be any more than that. For that reason the film succeeds.

This film works best as a guilty pleasure and should be appreciated as such. It's not high art, but it certainly does raise the bar for car chase sequences and the like.

title: Bad A$$ Movie!!!
review: Alls i gotz to say is this movie was a bad ass movie.I'll tell you since I know alot about street racing b/cause i do race,the stunts and the cars were off the hook!!I loved Vin Diesel(Dominic Toretto).I am the BIGGEST fan of Vin.he is HOTT,fine,sexy,good looking,and i better stop b/c i could go on and on.Nobody is a bigger fan then i am.The movie was great,and the people that were in it were so good for their part.The one part that got me fired up was when Brian(Paul Walker) busted in on Johnny Tran(Rick Yune) and his gang.But the one part that i was mostly looking at was the way Letty(Michelle Rodriguez)and Dom.(Vin) were kissing.I loved how he lifted her up by her ass.It had a good plot and a good climax.I just can't wait till the sequal comes out.I'm just mad b/c the main person i wanted to be in there is not going to be in there(Vin Diesel).I'll tell you don't worry about all them haters out there that say it was dumb,boring,stupid,etc...don't worry bout them just keep doing a good job with the movie it was great trust me.I'm an expert on all this car racing stuff and it was GREAT!!

title: What better way to spend 2 hours...
review: This may be niave as I am come from the United Kingdom and do not know much about the Street Racing scene - but does it really matter? No! This movie was fantastic!  Who cares about how realistic everything is? The cars look amazing, the women even better! It is slickly shot and the stunt scenes are brilliant.  Rob Cohen's DVD Commentary is fascinating.  To listen to someone talk so passionately about their movie just heightens the experience even more.  OK, so the dialogue is laughable in parts and the plot is somewhat lacking but does that really matter for this type of movie?  All this movie requires is that you sit back, switch the brain off and get swept away by all that is going on and sit in awe of the people who actually own the cars. Then when it is over, go back and watch it again but this time listen to the excellent commentary!

title: Terrible
review:
"The Fast and the Furious" is basically your standard summer blockbuster - stupid, loud, and lots of explosions. Amazingly, this movie sinks to depths that most summer blockbusters have never reached.

The story surrounds an undercover FBI agent (Paul Walker) who is trying to find out who has been stealing electronics equipment. This leads him to a group of underground street drag racers. Despite the numerous plot holes, such as the idiotic way in which the criminals go about stealing the equipment, and Walker's inexplicable behavior, this movie actually could've been good. The premise is interesting, and the drag racing scenes are fairly exciting.

Where this movie falters is the characters. None of them are interesting, and despite the script's best efforts, they are all two-dimensional. The performances are awful, with the exception of Vin Diesel, who is merely average. Walker delivers his stupid catch phrases inconvincingly monotone. Perhaps the script is much to blame here, for I've often believed that good performances are highly influenced by the script, i.e. a good actor can give a bad performance if the dialogue is bad. Well, anyway, the dialogue is simply some of the worst in any big budget movie I've seen recently.

On the plus side, the action sequences are pretty good. However, this simply cannot make up for a senseless script and horrible acting. Not really worth seeing, unless you really like action, with nothing to back it up.

* 1/2 out of ****

title: Awesome movie, great cast!
review: I personally loved this movie and have never really been too interested in cars until now.  I am a huge fan of the gorgeous Paul Walker, so I was thrilled to learn that he was in this movie and I thought that he did an awesome job portraying Brian Spillner/Brian O'Connor.  I was also impressed with Chad Lindberg and his part playing Jesse, I wish he had a bigger part though...he's a talented actor.  Vin Diesel was someone that I was introduced to in this movie.  I think he also did a great job in this movie and really pulled the movie together with his great acting skills. So...all in all...I highly recommend this movie to anyone and I can't wait for the sequel to come out!!!

title: Horrible
review: This movie was horrible... that's the bottom line. It was made for the moronic pre pubescents to immature teens group. If you have an IQ of over, lets say.... 80? please oh please stay away from this load of crap. The only people I know who enjoyed this movie were kids who dont know what a good movie is, dumb girls who think paul walker and/or vin diesel is/are hot, or morons. Even though this movie was set to "entertain," it DID not entertain me. I dont need some silly movie to see some pretty cars. Even some of my friends who are fast-car fanatics, hated this movie. But hey, you may like it.

title: HEMI? BLOWER? TRAIN? MODIFIED?
review:
I really liked this movie and the DVD is something else to listen to the director talk through the entire movie is interesting.

But see I am a chick right:....... so can someone out there tell me how the following can take place: Can one tell me how you can have the nitris on that long? How come they never purge the system through out the movie? How come majority of the time you see the black car running the butterflies are never open and the belt and pully is not moving? How come the black car stays perfect in the wheely scene that far that long with no wheelie bars? How come when it flips over the supercharger stays intact? oh the kicker...... How come when the "wolf pack" blows the first car up and the two actors where that close, how come the concusion from that intense a blast didn't kill them? HOLLYWOOD....that is how. All and all I did like the movie and I rate it a 10! (I noticed all this in the movie theater the first time went back to see it a second time to make sure I seen what I seen and then bought the DVD to see if it helped me out......NO) IS THERE REALLY A RACE WARS?

title: It doesn't matter if you doze off for one second or one hour...
review:
...falling asleep because of a badly clichd movie is falling asleep because of a badly cliched movie.

Clich #1: Scantily-clad women with no purpose other than temptation and eye-candy.

#2: The all brawn and no brain nor bravado "hottie," Vin Diesel.

#3: Razor-thin plots.

#4: A situation-driven screenplay that could easily have been mistaken for two-ply or Enron stock certificates.

ANALYSIS: I prayed three Hail Marys and an Our Father in hopes that my sins would be immediately forgiven and I would be saved from the tortures of Hell. Just as I said the final "Amen," "The Fast and the Furious" credits began to roll---proof positive that there is a God.

GRADE: F

title: I agree...the CD is better than the movie
review: No Plot, no rhyme or reason...period. I mean, a whole lotta cars racing for the sake of...? And if it wasn't for my free PPV coupon, I never would've even considered it. However, Vin Diesel is a hottie...along with Mr. Paul Walker, though, they really didn't choose the right film to star in for credibility....cuidate and hope you can find a better reason for the making of this movie people.

title: Vin Diesel morphs into Jack Black!
review:
I am getting sick of looking at Jack Black. A few years back, nobody knew who he was, and he was cool. Now it's cool to like Jack Black. He's the main thing. Vin Diesel, too, is going through the exact same motions.

Anyway, the movie sucked and sucked hard. So let me get this straight - grease monkeys, that's Vin and his gang, work for meager wages in a garage and can still afford these high-powered racing cars, which I presume cost upwards of 50 to 100 grand, only to be put to use grinding the gears and blowing the motors? Heck, even when these fast cars are used for the highjackings, the only thing they take is petty merchandise like DVD players and stereos! Talk about a non-profit scheme, Vin.

Bland, un-interesting, and Swayze and Reeves did it years ago under the title 'Point Break'... Avoid this utter garbage like the plague!

title: This is a joke right?
review: This movie blew chunks all over my popcorn. IT sucked. The first time I saw this movie it was pretty good, when it was called "Point Break." I actually thought they ripped the screenplay off as a joke. Not nearly as blatant as Bruce Willis and "Last Man Standing" ganking Clint Eastwood's "A Fist Full of Dollars," but it's close. All I could do was walk out and say "Vios con dios, bra."

title: The Coolest B Movie ever made
review: This is a B movie to the "t"!  Bad acting (except for vin diesel), cheesy lines, unoriginal story, but a fairly original subject matter for a movie... Street racing.  And did I mention revolutionary/AWESOME direction of action and racing scenes.   The last 5 minutes of the movie alone are worth the money to see this movie.  It leaves you with one hell of a WOW feeling. The movie features "new" car racing, that is mostly Asian Cars suped up with nitris oxide or premium engine modifications to make them extra fast. Only at the end do we see the highlight of the film an old hot rod that leavez you droolin at the sound of it's revving. This movie is pretty much an exact remake of Point Break except with Street racing the subject matter instead of surfing.  But the storyline and plot are good enough to get you through to all the action/racing scenes which are incredible and groundbreaking. The director does an awesome job with the action/racing scenes.  The new cool way the race scenes are filmed can be compared to the new cool way the fighting scenes were filmed in the matrix (except no special effects here). The movie has a certain element of pazzaz and the race scenes and the action scenes in general are well done and suspenseful as hell.  You gotta see this movie.

title: Modern Day Rebel Without a Cause
review: This was a real good flick.  Never boring with lots of action and some interesting twists.  I never really knew where this film was going and who might betray who.  Also the acting was very good even to the smallest part. James Dean Lives and even the nervous mechanic was much like Sal Mineo in Rebel Without a Cause.  Great movie.

title: Action packed race with hot stars
review: Their are three great reasons to see this movie. Paul Walker, Vin Disel, and the fast cars. I loved everything about this movie. It didn't end quite the way I wanted it too but I couldn't think of a perfect way to end it. This movie is worth seeing more than once. The story line managed to keep me interested while the racing scences kept me on the edge of my seat. I highly recommend this movie.

title: WICKED!
review: I think that this movie was one of the best that i have EVER seen.  It was so good.  It was filled with action packed thrilling ride.  It allowed us to look at all the actors and see what they're like.  I would recommend seeing this movie a million times.  I have seen it once and plan on seeing it again.  Trust me...it was well worth paying for.

title: What a Rush!
review:
Ever since seeing the trailer a few months back, I could not wait to see this. This was by far the best car racing movie I have seen in a long time. The last great ones that come to mind are Days of Thunder and The Wraith. Even though the plot seemed very familiar (Point Break), I was very impressed.

The action did not stop. Lots of Laughing gas and tricked out cars going 140+ mph. Although I am not a big fan of imports, I liked to see they did things the right way. Most cars I see like that are all show and no go. These really moved! Granted they had to drop like $80k to get them into the 10's... But there is a lot of work that needs to be done to a small engine to turn that kind of power.

My hands were still shaking from the adrenaline rush 20 minutes after the movie ended. If you like fast cars or racing of any sort go and see this again and again.

title: Quickly Runs out of Gas
review:
Do you like car chases? I mean, do you REALLY love car chases? You had better if you plan on watching "The Fast and the Furious," because that is all it has to offer. The movie starts off promisingly enough, but quickly degenerates into a poor copy of 1991's "Point Break." All they did was substitute cars for surf boards! Of course, "Point Break" actually went through the bother of explaining Keanu Reeves motivation. Without giving away a small surprise, "The Fast and the Furious" never adequately explains why Paul Walker's character wanted to enter the world of racing. Was he trying to advance his career? Did he simply love the smell of new cars, and who doesn't!?! In any event, his motivation, and several other things are left to the audiences imagination.

So is this a terrible movie? No, not really. Plot deficiencies aside, the racing scenes are really quite well done. On many occasions the camera moves inside the engine, and we are able to see and hear the pistons roar! The movie plays like a two hour music video, with a soundtrack that rarely screeches to a halt. With a deft touch, this movie could have amounted to something. That's why the films lousy script will make you furious! 2 and a half stars out of 5.

title: Rob Cohen on NOS
